title: Poland: Kronenberg Foundation Supports Jagiellonian University Museum
summary: Warsaw, Poland - The Kronenberg Foundation at Citi Handlowy has sponsored a new interactive mathematics exhibition titled "Everything is a Number" at the Jagiellonian University Museum, Collegium Maius in Kraków. The project was made possible by a 90,000 zloty donation from the Kronenberg Foundation's Grant Program, which supports innovative education. The exhibition will be viewable to the public on December 13, 2012.
tag-1: Poland: Kronenberg Foundation Supports Jagiellonian University Museum
tag-2: Warsaw, Poland – The Kronenberg Foundation at Citi Handlowy has sponsored a new interactive mathematics exhibition titled "Everything is a Number" at the Jagiellonian University Museum, Collegium Maius in Kraków. The project was made possible by a 90,000 zloty donation from the Kronenberg Foundation's Grant Program, which supports innovative education. The exhibition will be viewable to the public on December 13, 2012.
tag-3: The exhibition is aimed at familiarizing the public with various everday-life applications of mathematics as well as in other sciences, such as physics, biology and chemistry. The goal of the project is to help overcome reluctance and apprehension that often occurs when coming into contact with the science. The exhibition is accompanied by an educational project including workshops and museum lessons for all ages and ability groups.
tag-4: Visitors will also have the opportunity to explore various mathematical problems through experiments and games, and to rediscover forgotten mathematical instruments and unconventional calculation methods.
tag-5: "When choosing projects to fund under our Grant Program, we always aim for the most unique and worthwhile initiatives, educational or otherwise. I am convinced that supporting the Jagiellonian University Museum in this project will improve public knowledge about mathematics and shed a different light on the science, showing how accessible and practical it can be in a person's daily life. Indeed, our experience attests to a constant need for such innovative educational projects addressed to children, youths and adults," says Krzysztof Kaczmar, President of the Kronenberg Foundation at Citi Handlowy.
tag-6: 'Everything is a Number' will be available to the public in Jagiellonian University Museum for at least five years. Further plans for the exhibition follow the pattern applied to previous exhibitions organized by Jagiellonian University Museum in Kraków, transforming the project into a touring exhibition.
tag-7: 'Everything is a Number' interactive exhibition has received honorary patronage from His Magnificence, chancellor of Jagiellonian University, Professor Wojciech Nowak.

tag-12: Since its establishment in 1996 the Kronenberg Foundation has supported its founder, Citi Handlowy, in pursuing its community mission in such areas as education, support to local communities and preservation of cultural heritage. Its projects include, among others, My Finances – a financial education program for secondary school students, organized in cooperation with the National Bank of Poland and the Junior Achievement Foundation; Employee Volunteering Program (developed to encourage community involvement among the employees of Citi Handlowy), competitions: Microentrepreneur of the Year and Competition for Bank Handlowy Award for Special Achievements in the Theory of Economics and Finance, as well as the Aleksander Gieysztor Award for outstanding achievements in the preservation of Polish cultural heritage.
